TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ImageCodecInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The ImageCodecInfo class provides the necessary storage members and methods to retrieve all pertinent information about the installed image encoders and decoders (called codecs). Not inheritable.

remarks.format: ## Remarks GDI+ uses image encoders to convert the images stored in <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap> objects to various file formats. Image encoders are built into GDI+ for the BMP, JPEG, GIF, TIFF, and PNG formats. An encoder is invoked when you call the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.Save%2A> or <xref:System.Drawing.Image.SaveAdd%2A> method of a <xref:System.Drawing.Image> object.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <xref:System.Guid> structure that contains a GUID that identifies a specific codec.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Guid> structure that contains a GUID that identifies a specific codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the name of the codec.
Docs.value: A string that contains the name of the codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets string that contains the path name of the DLL that holds the codec. If the codec is not in a DLL, this pointer is .
Docs.value: A string that contains the path name of the DLL that holds the codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets string that contains the file name extension(s) used in the codec. The extensions are separated by semicolons.
Docs.value: A string that contains the file name extension(s) used in the codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets 32-bit value used to store additional information about the codec. This property returns a combination of flags from the enumeration.
Docs.value: A 32-bit value used to store additional information about the codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that describes the codec's file format.
Docs.value: A string that describes the codec's file format.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a <xref:System.Guid> structure that contains a GUID that identifies the codec's format.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Guid> structure that contains a GUID that identifies the codec's format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageCodecInfo[] GetImageDecoders() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of objects that contain information about the image decoders built into GDI+.
Docs.returns: An array of objects. Each object in the array contains information about one of the built-in image decoders.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageCodecInfo[] GetImageEncoders() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of objects that contain information about the image encoders built into GDI+.
Docs.returns: An array of objects. Each object in the array contains information about one of the built-in image encoders.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, which is a parameter of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event handler. The code uses the GetImageEncoders method to retrieve all the codec information for all installed image encoders and codecs, and then draws all the information about each codec to the screen.
[!code-cpp[System.Drawing.Imaging.ClassicImageCodecExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.drawing.imaging_3_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.Imaging.ClassicImageCodecExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.drawing.imaging_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Drawing.Imaging.ClassicImageCodecExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.drawing.imaging_3_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the codec's Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type.
Docs.value: A string that contains the codec's Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a two dimensional array of bytes that can be used as a filter.
Docs.value: A two dimensional array of bytes that can be used as a filter.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a two dimensional array of bytes that represents the signature of the codec.
Docs.value: A two dimensional array of bytes that represents the signature of the codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the version number of the codec.
Docs.value: The version number of the codec.
